Footage from Dnipro last night, which was targeted by dozens of drones and missiles. Large fires are now burning into the morning hours. Widespread power outages are now reported in large parts of the city.
The first video shows two Kinzhal missiles impacting the Prydniprovsk Thermal Power Plant (48.40742, 35.11378).

Footage from Dnipro last night, which was targeted by dozens of drones and missiles. Large fires are now burning into the morning hours. Widespread power outages are now reported in large parts of the city.
The first video shows two Kinzhal missiles impacting the Prydniprovsk Thermal Power Plant (48.40742, 35.11378).
NASA FIRMS data shows fires burning at the Prydniprovsk Thermal Power Plant in Dnipro (media 1 & 2), and the Dnipro Hydroelectric Power Plant in Zaporizhzhia City (media 3 & 4).
NASA FIRMS data shows fires burning at the Prydniprovsk Thermal Power Plant in Dnipro (media 1 & 2), and the Dnipro Hydroelectric Power Plant in Zaporizhzhia City (media 3 & 4).
Footage from the missile attack on Kyiv last night. The first video shows two Iskander-M ballistic missiles impacting the Kyiv CHP-5 power station.
Footage from the missile attack on Kyiv last night. The first video shows two Iskander-M ballistic missiles impacting the Kyiv CHP-5 power station.

The IDF has begun its withdrawal to the "Yellow Line", following the agreement and implementation of the peace plan. The attached video shows forces from the 1st "Golani" Brigade withdrawing from the Gaza Strip, back into Israel.

Last night, Pakistani fighter jets carried out a series of airstrikes on Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) in Afghanistan. 
At least 8 airstrikes were carried out on targets in Jalalabad, Khost, Margha, and the Afghan capital of Kabul. Unconfirmed reports state that TTP Chief Noor Wali Mehsud was killed in a targeted assassination strike, however TTP-affiliated sources deny this. Pakistan's military is set to hold an "extremely important" press-conference at 2:30pm local time, just under 4 hours from now. 
TTP (separate to the Afghan Taliban) is a militant group which primarily operates in Pakistan, carrying out attacks on the Pakistani military, as well as Shia Muslim civilians. 
Note: This is the only image from the strikes which I could find. All other images I have seen are old.
Expect rolling blackouts to begin across most/all regions of Ukraine soon. Their energy infrastructure just got hit very hard, and this is clearly only the beginning as they enter winter.
Scenes from the Sheikh Radwan Neighbourhood in Gaza City after the IDF withdrew. This is one of the areas Israel has most recently begun operating in. It now lies almost entirely in ruins.
Scenes from the Sheikh Radwan Neighbourhood in Gaza City after the IDF withdrew. This is one of the areas Israel has most recently begun operating in. It now lies almost entirely in ruins.

Israeli artillery shelling is targeting the northern part of Nuseirat Refugee Camp in Central Gaza, despite the implementation of the ceasefire.
Tank and armoured vehicle fire, as well as artillery shelling was also reported in Al-Bureij Refugee Camp, Khan Younis, Netzarim Corridor, northwestern Rafah. Unconfirmed reports also state that airstrikes were carried out on Gaza City and Al-Masdar village.

At least 3 Russian Tu-95MS strategic bombers are redeploying from Ukrainka Airbase in Amur Oblast, to Engels-2/Olenya Airbase in Saratov/Murmansk Oblast. 
The final preparations for the next large-scale missile attack (involving bombers) on Ukraine have almost been completed, with the attack likely to take place in the next 36 hours.

Russian VKS-affiliated source Fighterbomber confirms earlier claims that a Russian MiG-31 crashed. They stated that the crash occurred due to a landing failure, and that the crew ejected and survived. 
Ukrainian sources reported that it was a MiG-31K - a carrier of the Kinzhal missile - however Fighterbomber did not specify if the aircraft was of the K variant.
Footage showing some of the Russian Geran-2 drone strikes on the CHP-5 Power Plant in Kyiv.
Footage showing some of the Russian Geran-2 drone strikes on the CHP-5 Power Plant in Kyiv.

New SAR satellite images from October 10 show that Russia is continuing to expand the Navlya Training Ground in Bryansk Oblast, which is used to launch Geran-2 and Geran-3 drones. 
Previously, launches of drones only took place from vehicles, with the drones being stored in three underground bunkers (each bunker can store approximately 200 drones). However, now ground-based static launchers have been constructed to the west of the main launchers, which take less time and resources for launching drones. 
While it doesn't appear that this expansion is fully complete yet, we will likely see an increase in the number of drones launched from here in the near future. Additionally, Navlya is the only launch site north/northeast of Ukraine where Geran-3 jet drones can be launched.
Image credit:
StrategicaviationT on Telegram
Ukrainian_Intelligence on Telegram

At least 10 Israeli airstrikes targeted the town of Baisariyeh in southern Lebanon. The IDF claims that it was targeting Hezbollah facilities storing engineering equipment used to restore their military infrastructure.

Following the implementation of the ceasefire and the withdrawal of the IDF to the "yellow line", Hamas' internal security forces began deploying from the central and southern Gaza Strip to parts of Gaza City, Khan Younis, and Jabalia. 
Here, they have begun attempts at re-establishing civil authority over non-occupied areas in preparation for the next steps of the peace plan. Clashes were reported in Jabalia al-Balad in Northern Gaza between Hamas and a Palestinian clan that was allowed to stay in place by Israel during their operations in Gaza City, and has subsequently been left over after the IDF withdrew. Arrests of other armed militants by Hamas has also taken place.

Israeli Soldiers Killed Amid Army Withdrawal From Gaza (Videos) 
An Israeli soldier was killed in the Gaza Strip on October 9 just a few hours before the government approved a deal with Hamas that is meant to end the war, putting in motion a partial withdrawal from the Palestinian enclave.
In a statement, the Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) said that the soldier, a Technology and Maintenance Corps soldier in the 614th Combat Engineering Battalion, was killed in a Hamas sniper attack in Gaza City. A ceasefire as part of the deal reached a day earlier had not yet taken effect when the attack was carried out.
A total of nine Palestinians were killed and several more were wounded across Gaza by IDF fire on the same day, according to medical sources from the Strip.
Read more 
HERE

An "Autumn Thunder" Of Missiles: Russia's Escalates Assault On Ukraine's Power Grid
Moscow has taken decisive action. Ukraine's main power stations are under heavy attack. So far, Kyiv has been unable to fight back.
Since the beginning of October, the stakes in the conflict in Ukraine have risen significantly. Apparently, the Kremlin believes that the chances of peacefully settling the confrontation with Kyiv are zero. The meeting between Russian President Vladimir Putin and his American counterpart, President Donald Trump, did not result in any tangible progress towards ending hostilities or recognizing the situation on the ground.¬†
Read more 
HERE

Kiev Forces Are Getting Grinded In Pokrovsk (Video)
Kiev forces are taking heavy losses while attempting to hold onto their positions in the Dobropillia salient and the nearby city of Pokrovsk in the Donetsk direction, and despite that reports from October 10 indicate that the Russian military is still advancing.
In the Dobropillia salient, the Tsentr [Center] Group of Forces pushed Ukrainian troops out of Vladimirovka. This further secured Russian supply lines leading to Kucheriv Yar at the peak of the salient. It also put more pressure on the Ukrainian pocket splitting the salient from Shakhove to Toret‚Äôske.
To the south of the salient, battles continue in Pokrovsk with clear advantage to the Tsentr Group of Forces. Still, Ukraine seems determined to fight in the indefensible city to the last soldier.
Read more 
HERE

Russian Army Is About To Choke Seversk, Reach Kostiantynivka (Videos)
The Russian military is about to make a serious breakthrough between Seversk and Liman in Donetsk, according to reports from October 10, which also revealed a desperate Ukrainian attempt to slow down the attack on Kostiantynivka nearby.
The Yug [South] Group of Forces made serious gains in Yampil, imposing control over a large part of the settlement‚Äôs north part after securing most of the eastern part.
Moving to the west in Donetsk, the Yug Group of Forces attack on Kostiantynivka appears to be gaining momentum once again.
Read more 
HERE

Pakistan Kills Senior TTP Members In Unprecedented Strikes On Afghanistan‚Äôs Kabul (Videos)
Pakistan launched unprecedented strikes on the Afghan capital, Kabul, late on October 9, targeting two senior members of the Tehrik-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP), which is more commonly known as the Pakistani Taliban.
The strikes targeted the Abdul Haq Square area of Kabul, close to several ministries and the national intelligence agency.
Read more

AHEAD OF THE STORM: MAJOR RUSSIAN REDEPLOYMENT FROM POKROVSK POINTS TO FORTHCOMING OFFENSIVE

Frontline Situation: Heavy Fighting In Vovchansk And Lull In Tetkino 
The Russian 70th Regiment is consolidating its position in Mala Tokmachka. Russian units are expanding their zone of control and conducting clearance operations on the right bank of the Yanchur River. The Ukrainian military leadership is seeking reserves to replenish its assault groups.
A parade featuring units of the Korean People's Army (KPA) who had returned from the Kursk Oblast was held in Pyongyang.
